basics.name: Christoph Minz
basics.proficiency: Researcher in theoretical and mathematical physics

work.name: Institut für Analysis (and Riemann Center for Geometry and Physics), Leibniz-Universität Hannover
work.summary: Investigating bounds for relative entropy and modular Hamiltonians in quantum field theory, in collaboration with Ko Sanders (and Adriano Chialastri).

work.name: Scuola Internazionale Superiore di Studi Avanzati (SISSA)
work.summary: Extended the previously developed numerical scheme to approximate the modular Hamiltonian of quantum field theories with boundaries and defects, in collaboration with Erik Tonni.

work.name: Emmy Noether research group of Daniela Cadamuro, Institut für Theoretische Physik, Universität Leipzig
work.summary: Established a numerical scheme and used analytic perturbation techniques to approximate modular Hamiltonians for (massive) quantum fields in setups where (exact) analytic solutions remain unknown. (go to the project page).
highlights: Supervision of Enzo Ebert (with Rainer Verch, research project and Bachelor thesis 'Tunneling time and entropic measurements', 2023-2024)
Co-supervision of Mark Bradshaw, Elija Engelhardt, and Adam Highfield (summer students with Kasia Rejzner at University of York, 2022-2024)
Supervision of Lasse Hertle (with Rainer Verch, research project and Master thesis 'Oscillation Effects in XY Spin Chain Entropies', 2021-2023)
Seminar teaching: 'Theoretische Physik 3: Analytische Mechanik und Elektrodynamik (Lehramt)' (WS 2022)

work.name: PSI Energy Markets GmbH
work.summary: Maintained the PSI software (using Java and SQL) and implemented new customer requests. Rolled out updates and hotfixes to customers (power/gas supply companies and energy markets).
